author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Metals: Gold Inches Higher as Stocks Fall
text:
Gold prices inched higher and were on track to end a four-session losing streak Thursday with the dollar little changed and stocks falling.
Gold for April delivery added 0.6%, to $1,322.20 a troy ounce, on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices had fallen in four straight sessions entering Thursday with the dollar rebounding from multiyear lows, as a stronger dollar makes gold and other dollar-denominated commodities more expensive for overseas buyers.
...
